questions.question: What are the synthesis conditions for Pb(Clterpy)[Au(CN)2]2?
questions.answer: To synthesize Pb(Clterpy)[Au(CN)2]2, Clterpy was dissolved in methanol, to which a methanol solution containing Pb(ClO4)2·xH2O was added. The solution was heated until all Clterpy dissolved, cooled to room temperature, and then a methanol solution of [nBu4N][Au(CN)2]·1/2H2O was added dropwise. The solution was allowed to evaporate for several days to form yellow crystals.

questions.question: What method was used to measure the birefringence values of the coordination polymers?
questions.answer: Birefringence values were measured using polarized-light microscopy with a tilting thick Berek compensator at λ = 546.1 nm at room temperature.

questions.question: How does the birefringence of Mn(Brterpy)[Au(CN)2]2 compare to that of Mn(terpy)[Au(CN)2]2?
questions.answer: The birefringence of Mn(Brterpy)[Au(CN)2]2 is 0.50(3), which is larger than the birefringence of Mn(terpy)[Au(CN)2]2, indicating that the substitution of terpy with Brterpy increased the birefringence.

questions.question: True or False: The birefringence of Pb(Clterpy)[Au(CN)2]2 is significantly different from that of Pb(terpy)[Au(CN)2]2.
What structural feature is believed to be the primary origin of high birefringence in the described coordination polymers?
questions.answer: The primary origin of high birefringence in the described coordination polymers is believed to be the face-to-face alignment of the terpyridine-based units.

questions.question: What role does the polarizability anisotropy of the C−X bond play in the birefringence of the coordination polymers?
questions.answer: The polarizability anisotropy of the C−X bond contributes to the birefringence by increasing the polarizability along the direction of maximum birefringence, especially when the bond is well-aligned in the measurement plane.

questions.question: True or False: The birefringence of Pb(Brterpy)(μ-OH2)0.5[Au(CN)2]2 is the highest among the terpy-based polymers reported.
How does the crystal growth direction affect the measured birefringence of monoclinic crystals?
questions.answer: The measured birefringence of monoclinic crystals depends on the crystal growth direction, as it may represent the difference between two principal components of the indicatrix or a slice of the indicatrix, affecting the observed birefringence value.

questions.question: True or False: The addition of highly polarizable halogen atoms always increases the birefringence of a coordination polymer.
What is the significance of the stereochemically active lone pair in Pb-based coordination polymers?
questions.answer: The stereochemically active lone pair in Pb-based coordination polymers affects the symmetry and bond lengths around the Pb(II) center, influencing the structure and potentially the birefringence of the polymer.
